modules.description: Provides pretty-printers for error and write error types, and implements asynchronous read, write, and close operations on a flow. Reads return a buffer with available data or end-of-file, while writes send data or report closure. Works with Cstruct.t buffers, flow handles, and custom error types to manage network communication.

Provides functions for reading from and writing to buffered channels, including blocking and non-blocking operations. Works with byte sequences and abstracts over underlying flow implementations. Used to manage data transmission in networked applications with controlled buffer sizes.

Provides functions to read and write data through buffered channels, including reading characters, lines, and exact byte counts, as well as writing strings, buffers, and lines. Operates on flow objects and uses Cstruct.t for data buffers, with error handling for read and write operations. Supports asynchronous I/O with Lwt, enabling blocking reads and flushes for network or file-based flows.
